newsitem.title: QATAR: Qatar bourse off one pct in post dividend slip.
newsitem.headline: Qatar bourse off one pct in post dividend slip.

text.p: Qatar's unofficial stock market ended over one percent lower as prices of some leading stocks were marked down after dividend announcements, brokers said.
They said some heavyweights, including market leader Qatar National Bank, were adjusted down by the extent of their recently-announced dividends.

The Commercial Bank of Qatar's 18-share index shed 1.48 points to 127.53 points from 129.01 the previous week, dragged down by a 135 riyal plunge in QNB shares, which account for a third of the total market capitalisation of $1.9 billion.
QNB closed at 525 riyals against 660 the previous week after it announced a cash dividend equal to 25 percent of capital and a one-for-four bonus issue.
The CBQ lost 30 riyals to 318 after a payout of a dividend equal to 30 percent of the capital and a rights issue of one share for every two held at a premium of 250 riyals.
Qatar Shipping shed 2.50 riyals to 45.50 after distributing that amount in a cash dividend.
Another loser was Qatar Navigation which gave up 20 riyals to 680 as demand dried up.
Gainers included Doha Bank Ltd, which advanced three riyals to 313, Al Khaleej Insurance, which rose five riyals to 250 and Qatar Cement, which gathered two riyal to 325.
